details.title: Adaptive Detection Probabilities for Fluctuating Target Models in Nonhomogeneous Gaussian Noise
details.abstract: Under the assumption that the average noise power may vary from cell to cell, new, more easily computed expressions are given for the probability of detecting a fluctuating target by means of a cell-averaging CFAR test. The generalized chi-square family of fluctuating targets is considered with the Swerling I and III models given as special cases.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
